page.title: 20Social Concerns
page.content: In common with other areas, Cheddleton has felt the cold draught brought about by the falling birthrate and economic pressures. The middle school opened in 1982, is now to close and the children affected will have to travel to Leek or Cellarhead. Local voices were raised in dissent but there was no alternative. It seems that an 'ill wind' has brought the possibility of the middle school now becoming the village hall, since the Village Parish Institute has no car park and few amenities. The village has layers of opinion, the old residents, nurses, and medical staff at the local psychiatric hospital, and residents who commute to Leek or Stoke-on-Trent.
